TextBody:
Hi Sharnitha,

Thank you for your patience!

I found out the following information about alerts.
Alerts are being triggered either when a specific threshold is reached or at predefined intervals.
They are sent in bulk once a threshold (100 logs) is reached, or, alternatively, alerts are sent on a timed basis—every 2 hours—regardless of volume, after they were processed on the server.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000O1MFE:ref

Hi Support,
Good day to you!

Thank you for the information provided.

I have shared the details with the customer, and they have a few concerns and questions as outlined below:

  *   Is it possible to configure the 100 logs threshold or the 2-hour threshold? If so, could you kindly share the steps or documentation on how this can be configured?
  *   Is there any reference document or URL available for further details?

The customer has expressed a need to receive email alerts more promptly. Their concern is that if the 100-log threshold is not met, they may not receive any alerts, or may only receive them after two hours-delaying their ability to take immediate action.

We would appreciate your assistance in addressing these queries and concerns.

Also, please let us know if we can have meeting with customer, if so kindly let us know your availability for 16th or 17th April Malaysia Time (after 11:30 AM). Please share 2-3 time slots.

Thank you for your continued support.

Best Regards,

TextBody:
Hi Milan,

I apologise, we made a small mistake previously and sent you the wrong information.

The job that gathers and sends the logs via email, runs every 2 minutes, not hours. It checks for all unsent alerts and sends them, either when there are 100 events, or every two minutes, even if there are only 4 events for example.

We can't configure this job, because the limits were imposed to not overload the server.

Does the customer still want to have a remote session? I am available on the 17th, from 3 or 4pm Malaysia time.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

@9.01am copy file2.txt to USB

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: 15 April 2025 05:03 PM
To: Milan Singh <milan@halodata.asia>
Cc: Sharnitha Seethaiah <sharnitha@halodata.asia>; Sivakumar Mahathevan <cva@halodata.asia>
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #441854 - - Query on Email Alert Timing and Activity Count in Endpoint Protector [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0O1MFE:ref ]



 

Hi Milan,

I apologise, we made a small mistake previously and sent you the wrong information.

The job that gathers and sends the logs via email, runs every 2 minutes, not hours. It checks for all unsent alerts and sends them, either when there are 100 events, or every two minutes, even if there are only 4 events for example.

We can't configure this job, because the limits were imposed to not overload the server.

Does the customer still want to have a remote session? I am available on the 17th, from 3 or 4pm Malaysia time.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Thank you for your patience!

I found out the following information about alerts.
Alerts are being triggered either when a specific threshold is reached or at predefined intervals.
They are sent in bulk once a threshold (100 logs) is reached, or, alternatively, alerts are sent on a timed basis—every 2 hours—regardless of volume, after they were processed on the server.

Ticket Number: 00441854
Ticket Subject: Query on Email Alert Timing and Activity Count in Endpoint Protector
Ticket Details: Customer (Chai Cheen Shun from Averis Sdn. Bhd.) has raised a query regarding the behavior of email alerts in Endpoint Protector (EPP).

Details:

Customer is aware of where to check all the records.

He would like to know how long it takes EPP to send an email once a user triggers an alert.

He observed inconsistencies:

Some email alerts report 1 activity detected.

Some email alerts report up to 10 activities at once.

Request:

Please confirm:

What is the expected delay (if any) between the alert trigger and email notification?

Customer is requesting clarification on the above points. Please advise.

Thank you!

Botond Biro
Technical Support Engineer
____________________ _________
Cybersecurity That Works for You

6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com<https://www.netwrix.com>
